summary: The 'Helping Allies Respond to Piracy, Overfishing, and Oceanic Negligence Act' (HARPOON Act) amends U.S. Code to authorize the Secretary of Defense to support foreign security forces in countering illegal, unreported, and unregulated (IUU) fishing. It directs the Secretary of the Navy and the Commandant of the Coast Guard to establish joint patrols with foreign partners to combat IUU fishing and transnational crime, and enhance regional security.  The bill mandates a yearly report to Congress on these engagements.
